intro: Labordia venosa, commonly known as the veined labordia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with prominent veins and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and red. Labordia venosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant. It prefers warm, humid conditions and well-draining soil to thrive.
